defect.para: This Recall applies to AmTran RE™ buses built from March 1, 1998 through July 16, 1999.

Transportation Products, Inc. has determined that some emergency exit windows, manufactured and shipped to AmTran for use in AmTran RE buses, fail to conform to Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standard No. 217, "Bus Emergency Exits and Window Retention and Release" [Part 49 CFR 577.5(b)(2)]. Failure of the emergency exit latches can inhibit exit from the vehicle in an emergency.

The buses contained in this recall have windows that may have one or more of the following conditions: (a) latch operating instruction error, (b) high opening forces, (c) failure of window to fully latch or unlatch, (d) inability to deactivate warning buzzer, and/or (e) rivet missing from exterior latch cable lever.
Owners are being notified of this recall and have been directed to contact an AmTran Alliance dealer to make arrangements for inspection and remedy of the defect.

svcsubproc.title: Condition "a" - interior latch operation instruction error
svcsubproc.para: If the interior latch operating decal reads "1. PULL RED HANDLE UPWARD 2. PUSH LOWER EDGE OF GLASS OUT" corrective action must be taken.

Corrective action requires replacement of the interior latch operating decal with one that reads " 1. LIFT TO UNLATCH 2. PUSH TO OPEN." Please complete and return the " AUTHORIZATION FOR RECALL SERVICE" card checking box #8.

svcsubproc.title: Condition "b" - high opening forces

item.para: Open window by lifting up on the interior latch and pushing out.
Window should open with minimal effort from the operator.

svcsubproc.para: If the window fails to open with minimal effort from the operator, corrective action must be taken. Corrective action requires replacing the gas cylinders on the window. Please complete and return the " AUTHORIZATION FOR RECALL SERVICE" card checking box #9.

svcsubproc.title: Condition "c" - failure of window to fully latch or unlatch
svcsubproc.para: This is a two-part condition and will be referred to as Condition c1 and Condition c2.

item.para: From the inside of the bus, push outward on window as shown in Figure 1 without operating the emergency release latch. Window should not push open.

svcsubproc.para: If the window can be pushed open corrective actions must be taken.
Corrective action requires adding a spacer under the egress keepers. Please complete and return the " AUTHORIZATION FOR RECALL SERVICE" card checking box #10.

figure.caption: Push out on window from inside of bus here. Interior view of window shown.

item.para: Check interior egress latch handle for correct positioning (see Figure 2).
Incorrect positioning of latch handle is shown in Figure 3.

svcsubproc.para: If the interior latch handle will not stay in the correct position as described in the inspection procedure, corrective action must be taken.
Corrective action requires replacement of the interior egress latch. Please complete and return the " AUTHORIZATION FOR RECALL SERVICE" card checking box #11.

svcsubproc.title: Condition "d" - inability to deactivate warning buzzer

item.para: Turn bus ignition to "on" position. Window warning buzzer should not operate if window is in fully closed position. If the buzzer is activated, follow procedure "C".
Open window. Window warning buzzer should operate as soon as handle is activated to release the latch.

Depress warning buzzer switch actuation lever to stop buzzer operation. If the buzzer does not stop operating with the lever depressed, the switch will need replacing. See corrective action "a". If warning buzzer stops when the lever is depressed, adjustment is required. See corrective action "b".

svcsubproc.para: Corrective Action "a" - requires replacement of the warning buzzer switch. Please complete and return the " AUTHORIZATION FOR RECALL SERVICE" card checking box #12.
Corrective Action "b" - Warning Buzzer Switch Activation Bracket Adjustment Procedure:

step1.para: Raise window to fully opened position.
Loosen screws on warning buzzer switch activation bracket (see Figure 4).
Slide warning buzzer switch activation bracket toward switch.
Turn bus ignition switch to "on" position (warning buzzer should be activated) and lower window carefully to the closed position (warning buzzer should be deactivated).

caution.para: Do not allow window to slam closed. Damage to the warning buzzer switch may result unless proper adjustment is achieved.

step1.para: Warning buzzer bracket should be adjusted as close to the switch body as possible. Switch lever may be bent outward to provide for more adjustment if necessary.

svcsubproc.title: Condition "e" - rivet missing from exterior latch cable lever
svcsubproc.para: Check exterior latch for rivet as shown in Figure 5.
If the rivet is not in the exterior latch, corrective action must be taken. Please complete and return the " AUTHORIZATION FOR RECALL SERVICE" card checking box #13.

laborinfo.para: Adjustment of warning buzzer switch activation bracket - 0.2 hour.
Inspection and documentation completion time for all of the above is 0.25 hour.

responuscan.para:
Proceed immediately to make necessary correction to units in inventory. All inventory vehicles subject to this recall campaign must be corrected prior to sale, transfer or delivery.
If vehicles have been sold or transferred and you are in receipt of Customer Notification Letters and Authorization for Recall Service cards for those vehicles, transfer location or customer must be notified from your dealer location.

The National Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act, as amended, provides that each vehicle that is subject to a vehicle recall campaign must be adequately repaired within a reasonable time after the owner has tendered it for repair. A failure to adequately repair within 60 days after a tender of a vehicle is prima facie evidence of failure to repair within a reasonable time. If the condition is not adequately repaired within 60 days, the owner may be entitled to replacement with an identical or reasonable equivalent vehicle at no charge, or to a refund of the purchase price less a reasonable allowance for depreciation.

In order to avoid having to replace an owner's vehicle or refund the purchase price, every effort must be made to promptly schedule an appointment with each owner to repair his vehicle as soon as possible.
